Personen, die die Zielperson gut kennen, können eine Weisheitsprüfung (Einsicht) durchführen, um herauszufinden, warum sich die Person so untypisch verhält.

Schauer des Bösen wird am häufigsten von bösen Klerikern gegen Paladine und gute Kleriker eingesetzt. Ihre Opfer werden wahrscheinlich mindestens für die Dauer des Zaubers in Ungnade fallen, und ihr Ruf könnte noch viel länger ruiniert sein. Das Ziel des Zaubers erinnert sich an alles, nachdem der Zauber beendet ist. Da die Person nicht unbedingt weiß, dass sie verzaubert wurde, ist es wahrscheinlich, dass ein guter Charakter enorme Reue über seine oder ihre Handlungen empfindet.

spell.name: Chilling Gaze
entries: Deine Augen werden kalt und frostig. Für die Dauer dieses Zaubers kannst du jedes Mal, wenn eine Kreatur ihren Zug innerhalb von 30 Fuß um dich herum beginnt, sie zu einem Rettungswurf der Konstitution zwingen. Die Kreatur muss in der Lage sein, deine Augen zu sehen, und du musst in der Lage sein, sie zu sehen. Wenn der Rettungswurf misslingt, erleidet die Kreatur {@damage 2d10} Kälteschaden und wird durch übernatürliches Frösteln gelähmt. Die Lähmung hält {@dice 2d4} Tage an; dieser Wert verringert sich auf 1 Tag, wenn das Opfer in einer Behausung gewärmt wird, in Pelze gehüllt ist, usw. Die Lähmung kann auch durch Magie beendet werden, die Lähmungen aufheben kann.
Kreaturen, die resistent oder immun gegen Kälteschaden sind, werden durch diesen Zauber nicht gelähmt.

spell.name: Chlorophyll
entries: Deine Haut nimmt einen grünen Farbton an, der es dir ermöglicht, Energie aus der Sonne zu ziehen. Solange du von diesem Zauber betroffen bist, brauchst du nichts zu essen und kannst unbegrenzt überleben, vorausgesetzt, du bekommst vier Stunden Sonnenlicht pro 24 Stunden. Du benötigst weiterhin normale Mengen an Wasser und Luft. Wenn du eine kurze Pause im direkten Sonnenlicht verbringst, erhältst du einen zusätzlichen Trefferpunkt pro Trefferwürfel, der während dieser kurzen Pause verbraucht wurde.

spell.name: Choose Fate

components.m: two grains of salt and a rose petal

entries: Du gewährst einer willigen Kreatur einen kurzen Blick in die Zukunft und die Möglichkeit, ihr Schicksal neu zu gestalten. Die Kreatur würfelt {@dice 1d20} zweimal und notiert die Würfe. Die Kreatur muss diese beiden Ergebnisse für ihre nächsten beiden {@dice d20} Würfe während der Dauer des Zaubers verwenden, aber sie kann die Reihenfolge der Ergebnisse wählen.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Für jeden verwendeten Zauberslot über der 3. Stufe kannst du eine zusätzliche Kreatur beeinflussen.

spell.name: Chronal Displacement
entries: Eine willige Kreatur, die du berührst, wird von der Zeit abgekoppelt und altert für die Dauer des Zaubers nicht.

Die Magie des Zaubers ist unberechenbar. Jeden Tag besteht eine 5%ige Chance, dass sich die Zeit für die Kreatur für 24 Stunden verlangsamt, wodurch die Kreatur den ganzen Tag lang wie unter dem Einfluss eines Verlangsamungszaubers handelt. Außerdem hat die Kreatur während dieser 24 Stunden einen Nachteil bei allen Rettungswürfen gegen jegliche Magie, die mit Zeit oder Alterung zu tun hat.

spell.name: Chrysalis
entries: Ein williges Lebewesen, das du berührst, wird in einen seidigen Kokon gehüllt. Solange es sich in diesem Kokon befindet, braucht es weder zu essen noch zu trinken. Am Ende der Stunde schlüpft es aus dem Kokon, als hätte es gerade eine lange Ruhepause eingelegt. Solange es im Kokon ist, ist es jedoch hilflos und kann nichts tun. Wenn sie vor dem Ende der Dauer des Zaubers erwacht, kann sie sich als Aktion aus dem Kokon befreien, was jedoch Gelegenheitsangriffe von benachbarten Feinden provoziert. Die Kreatur hat einen taktischen Nachteil bei Weisheitsprüfungen (Wahrnehmung), wenn sie in einem Kokon steckt.
Die Chrysalis hat 1 Trefferpunkt und AC 10. Wenn sie zerstört wird, endet der Zauber und die Kreatur ist {@condition stunned} bis zum Ende ihres nächsten Zuges.

spell.name: Circle of Divine Censure
entries: Du strahlst eine heilige Aura in einem Radius von 30 Fuß aus, die für Untote und Unholde ein Gräuel ist. Jeder Untote oder Unhold, der die Aura betritt oder seinen Zug in der Aura beginnt, erleidet {@damage 2d6} Strahlungsschaden und muss einen Rettungswurf in Charisma machen; wenn der Rettungswurf misslingt, muss die Kreatur die Aura so schnell wie möglich verlassen.

spell.name: Circle of Scrying
entries: Du ermächtigst einen magischen Kreis, der sich mit Siegeln des Sehens verbindet, die du zuvor erschaffen hast. Du kannst eine Anzahl von Siegeln wählen, die deinem Intelligenzmodifikator entspricht (mindestens 1). Die Entfernung zwischen dem Kreis des Hellsehens und den Siegeln des Sehens spielt keine Rolle, und die Siegel können sich sogar in anderen Dimensionen der Existenz befinden.

Wenn du dich innerhalb deines Kreises des Hellsehens befindest, kannst du den Bereich um jede der verbundenen Siegel betrachten, als ob du tatsächlich an der Stelle des Siegels stehen würdest. Du kannst zwischen verschiedenen Siegeln als Aktion wechseln.

Die Dauer des Zaubers hängt davon ab, ob der Kreis neu gezogen wird oder ob ein zuvor gesetzter, permanenter Kreis gestärkt wird. Das Ziehen eines neuen Kreises dauert einen Tag. Das Ermächtigen eines zuvor platzierten, permanenten Kreises dauert 1 Minute.
Das Zeichnen eines neuen Kreises erfordert Materialkomponenten, die 250 Goldstücke kosten. Der Kreis ist in der Regel ein flacher Entwurf einer geometrischen Form mit einem Radius von 5 Fuß.

Ein Siegel des Sehens wird erstellt, indem man eine Minute lang das Siegel auf eine flache Oberfläche zeichnet. Jedes Siegel benötigt eine spezielle Tinte, die 100 Goldstücke pro Siegel kostet. Das Siegel verschwindet innerhalb weniger Augenblicke nach dem Zeichnen, aber es erscheint wieder, wenn man durch es hindurch sieht. Ein Siegel ist in der Regel nicht größer als ein Zoll im Durchmesser. Während ein Siegel in Gebrauch ist, kann es von jedem bemerkt werden, der die Stelle, an der es gezeichnet wurde, untersucht und eine erfolgreiche DC 10-Überprüfung auf Weisheit (Wahrnehmung) oder Intelligenz (Erkundung) ablegt. Wenn das Siegel nicht in Gebrauch ist, erfordert das Auffinden des Siegels eine gezielte Suche in der richtigen Gegend und eine erfolgreiche Intelligenz-(Ermittlungs-)Prüfung gegen den DC deines Rettungswurfs für den Zauberspruch.

spell.name: Cirrem's Bewilderment
entries: Du wirst {@condition invisible} bis zum Ende der aktuellen Runde.

spell.name: Claws of Digging
entries: Du verwandelst die Hände einer willigen Kreatur in dicke, breite Klauen, mit denen sie sich durch Erde und Stein wühlen kann. Die Kreatur kann sich mit einer Geschwindigkeit durch Erde wühlen, die ihrer Landgeschwindigkeit entspricht, und mit einem Viertel dieser Geschwindigkeit durch Fels oder Stein.

Eine Kreatur, die sich durch Stein gräbt, hinterlässt einen Tunnel. Wenn sie sich durch weiche Erde gräbt, füllt sich der Tunnel hinter ihr (mit Erde, die vor der Kreatur ausgegraben wurde), es sei denn, die Kreatur verlangsamt sich auf die halbe Geschwindigkeit.
Außerdem verursachen die unbewaffneten Angriffe der Kreatur {@damage 2d6} Hiebschaden. Die Klauen gelten als hartnäckig.

spell.name: Claws of the Beast
entries: Deine Hände verwandeln sich in böse Klauen, so dass deine unbewaffneten Schläge {@damage 2d6} Hiebschaden verursachen. Du bist geübt im Umgang mit waffenlosen Schlägen.

spell.name: Cloak of Serpents
entries: Eine sich windende, sich windende, zischende Masse von Schlangen umgibt dich und schützt dich. Für die Dauer des Zaubers erhöht sich deine Rüstungsklasse um 2 und du kannst eine Aktion nutzen, um eine benachbarte Kreatur mit den Schlangen anzugreifen. Führe einen Nahkampf-Zauberangriff gegen eine benachbarte Kreatur durch. Wenn du triffst, erleidet die Kreatur {@damage 6d6} Giftschaden und ist {@condition poisoned}. Die {@condition poisoned} Kreatur muss am Ende jeder ihrer Runden einen Rettungswurf gegen Gift machen; ein erfolgreicher Rettungswurf beendet die Vergiftung.

spell.name: Clot
entries: Du berührst eine Kreatur und bringst ihr Blut dazu, in ihrem Körper zu erstarren. Die Kreatur muss einen Rettungswurf auf Konstitution machen. Wenn der Rettungswurf misslingt, erleidet die Kreatur {@damage 8d6} nekrotischen Schaden und verliert 2 Punkte Konstitution. Bei einem erfolgreichen Rettungswurf erleidet die Kreatur nur halben Schaden und verliert keine Konstitution.

spell.name: Cloth of Honorable Melee

components.m: a cloth emblazoned with holy symbol

entries: Du investierst die Macht deines Gottes in einen Stoffstreifen, der sich neben dir bewegt und sich gegen Fernkampfangriffe zur Wehr setzt. Du erhältst für die Dauer des Zaubers einen Bonus von +2 auf AC gegen Fernkampfangriffe.

spell.name: Cloud Burst
entries: Du sammelst vorhandenen Wasserdampf aus der Atmosphäre und lässt ihn als leichten Regen, Graupel oder Schnee in einem zylindrischen Bereich mit einem Radius von 60 Fuß und einer Höhe von 20 Fuß im Umkreis von 50 Fuß um dich herum fallen. Der Niederschlag hält für die Dauer des Zaubers an. Wenn die Temperatur in der Umgebung 32° C (90° F) oder mehr beträgt, verdoppelt sich die Dauer, außer in Wüstengebieten. In einem Gebiet, in dem die Temperatur zwischen -1° und 1° C (31° und 33° F) liegt, nimmt der Niederschlag die Form von Graupel an. Bei Temperaturen von -2° C (30° F) oder weniger fällt der Niederschlag als Schnee.

Wenn Wolkenbruch auf eine große oder größere Feuerquelle (z.B. eine Feuerwand) gewirkt wird oder wenn magische Hitze oder Feuer (z.B. ein Feuerball oder Flammenschlag) in den Bereich des Wolkenbruchs gewirkt wird, wabert 3 Runden lang eine Wolke aus warmem Nebel (wie ein Nebelwolken-Zauber behandeln) durch den Wirkungsbereich. Wird ein auf Kälte basierender Zauber oder Effekt auf ein von Wolkenbruch durchtränktes Gebiet gewirkt (z.B. ein Kältekegel auf regengetränktem Boden), bildet sich normales Eis. Dieses Eis bleibt für die Dauer des Zaubers bestehen, wenn die Temperatur unter 32° F liegt; andernfalls schmilzt das Eis normal, sobald die Temperatur über den Gefrierpunkt steigt.

spell.name: Cold Fog

components.m: a pinch of powdered crystal or glass

entries: Du erschaffst eine Wolke aus eisigem Nebel in einer Sphäre mit einem Radius von 20 Fuß, die auf einen Punkt zentriert ist, den du sehen kannst. Die Sphäre erstreckt sich um die Ecken herum, und ihr Bereich ist stark verdunkelt. Der Nebel ist halbfest und sein Gebiet gilt als schwieriges Terrain.
Jede Kreatur, die ihren Zug im Nebel beginnt oder ihn betritt, erleidet {@damage 4d6} Kälteschaden und ihre Geschwindigkeit ist bis zum Ende ihres Zuges um 10 Fuß reduziert.
Der Nebel hält für die Dauer des Zaubers an oder bis er durch einen Wind von mittlerer oder höherer Geschwindigkeit (mindestens 10 Meilen pro Stunde) aufgelöst wird.

spell.name: Combat Mind
entries: Du erhältst eine begrenzte Form der Telepathie, die es dir ermöglicht, die Bewegungen deiner Gegner im Kampf vorauszusehen. Dies gewährt dir einen +2 Rüstungsklassenbonus gegen Nahkampfangriffe und einen +3 Rüstungsklassenbonus gegen Fernkampfangriffe. Der Zauber wirkt nicht gegen Angreifer, die keinen Verstand haben (Automaten, geistlose Untote) oder deren Gedanken abgeschirmt sind.

spell.name: Commune with Shade

components.m: a wineskin full of fresh blood

entries: Du versuchst, den Geist eines bestimmten toten Wesens mit seinem Namen zu kontaktieren. Der Zauber kontaktiert den Geist und lässt ihn wissen, dass du ihn treffen willst; er zwingt den Geist nicht, vor dir zu erscheinen. Dieser Zauber ist am nützlichsten in der Unterwelt oder einem anderen Reich, wo es fast unmöglich ist, einen Schatten unter den unzähligen Heerscharen von Toten zu finden. Der Zauber übermittelt dem Schatten, den du suchst, deinen Ruf, deinen Standort und ein Gefühl der Dringlichkeit. Der Schatten ist nicht verpflichtet zu antworten, aber die meisten tun es, um die ewige Langeweile des Todes zu unterbrechen. Wenn der Schatten in der Unterwelt auf deinen Ruf antwortet, ist er innerhalb von zehn Minuten bei dir. Wenn Sie woanders sind, kommt der Schatten innerhalb von 24 Stunden.

Wenn der Zauber in der Unterwelt gewirkt wird, ist die Reichweite des Zaubers unbegrenzt. Wird der Zauber von der materiellen Welt oder einer anderen Dimension aus gewirkt, muss sich der Ort des Todes des Geistes auf der gleichen Ebene und innerhalb der Reichweite des Zaubers befinden. Beachte, dass sich die Reichweite auf den Ort des Todes der Kreatur bezieht, nicht auf ihren aktuellen Standort.

Dieser Zauber kann auch verwendet werden, um mit einer intelligenten untoten Kreatur in Reichweite Kontakt zu treten; zum Beispiel könnte er den Geist eines ertrunkenen Seemanns kontaktieren, wenn er innerhalb einer Meile um den Ort des Ertrinkens gewirkt wird.

Beachte, dass dieser Zauber weder die Persönlichkeit noch die Bereitschaft der Zielperson verändert, dir zu helfen. Sobald der Geist des Ziels eintrifft, musst du ihn durch Verhandlungen, Bezahlung oder irgendeine Art von Zwang dazu bringen, dir zu helfen. Familienmitglieder, Angehörige, Freunde und getötete Gefährten sind eher bereit zu helfen als Fremde oder jemand, der vom Zaubernden getötet wurde. Ein anderer Zauber, wie z. B. Sprechen mit den Toten, könnte nötig sein, um einen unkooperativen oder nicht ansprechbaren Schatten zu Antworten zu zwingen.

spell.name: Comrades in Arms
entries: Du erschaffst ein Band zwischen bis zu vier willigen Kreaturen, die du sehen kannst. Alle müssen sich in einem Umkreis von 30 Fuß von dir befinden. Für die Dauer des Zaubers kann eine Kreatur als Bonusaktion eine beliebige Anzahl ihrer Trefferpunkte auf eine andere Kreatur übertragen, die von dem Spruch betroffen ist. Alle Trefferpunkte, die eine Kreatur über ihre maximale Anzahl von Trefferpunkten hinaus erhöhen würden, werden als temporäre Trefferpunkte gewonnen. Temporäre Trefferpunkte, die durch diesen Zauber gewonnen werden, verschwinden, wenn der Zauber endet, aber andere Trefferpunktveränderungen sind permanent.

spell.name: Cone of Decay
entries: Du erschaffst einen 60 Fuß langen Kegel, der von deiner Hand ausgeht. Alle unbeaufsichtigte, nicht lebende, organische Materie innerhalb des Kegels zerfällt zu Staub. Jede Kreatur im Kegel muss einen Rettungswurf auf Konstitution machen. Wenn der Rettungswurf misslingt, wird die gesamte nichtmagische, organische Ausrüstung der Kreatur (Essen, Trinken, Kleidung, Leder, etc.) zerstört.
Untote Kreaturen verlieren zusätzlich 4 Punkte Konstitution bzw. 2 Punkte, wenn sie einen erfolgreichen Rettungswurf für Konstitution gemacht haben.

spell.name: Cone of Silence
entries: Du erschaffst eine Aura der Stille in einem Radius von 20 Fuß um dich herum, die sich mit dir bewegt. Innerhalb der Aura kannst nur du Geräusche machen; alle anderen Geräusche werden zum Schweigen gebracht. Darüber hinaus kann keine Kreatur innerhalb des betroffenen Bereichs Donnerschaden erleiden oder von schallbezogenen Zaubern betroffen sein, es sei denn, der Zauber wurde von dir gewirkt.

spell.name: Conflagration
entries: Du zeigst auf eine Kreatur in Reichweite und befiehlst ihr im Geiste, in Flammen aufzugehen. Die Kreatur muss einen Rettungswurf in Geschicklichkeit machen. Wenn der Rettungswurf misslingt, erleidet sie {@damage 6d10 + 20} Feuerschaden und beginnt zu brennen; bei einem erfolgreichen Rettungswurf erleidet sie die Hälfte des Schadens und erleidet keinen weiteren Effekt.
Eine brennende Kreatur erleidet am Ende jeder ihrer Runden {@damage 2d10} Feuerschaden. Das Feuer kann nicht auf natürliche Weise gelöscht werden; es brennt für die Dauer des Zaubers.

spell.name: Confounding Battlefield
entries: Jede intelligente Kreatur im Umkreis von 60 Fuß von dir (einschließlich dir) nimmt das Aussehen einer anderen Kreatur in der Umgebung an. Die Kreatur, der alles und jeder ähnelt, sollte zufällig ausgewählt werden. Jede Kreatur im Wirkungsbereich wird zu einer exakten Kopie des Originals, von den Gegenständen, die sie bei sich trägt, bis hin zum Klang ihrer Stimme.

Eine Kreatur, die den Effekt des Zaubers sieht, kann einen Rettungswurf für Intelligenz machen. Wenn der Rettungswurf misslingt, kann die Kreatur weder durch Sehen noch durch Hören unterscheiden, welche Kreatur welche ist. Bei einem erfolgreichen Schutzwurf sieht die Kreatur immer noch die Illusion, kann aber anhand von subtilen Hinweisen wie Körperhaltung oder Art der Bewegung erkennen, welche Kreatur die richtige ist.

Als Aktion kann eine Kreatur eine Intelligenz-(Erkundungs-)prüfung gegen den DC deines Rettungswurfs für den Zauberspruch ablegen. Wenn diese Prüfung erfolgreich ist, kann sie jede von der Illusion betroffene Kreatur korrekt identifizieren, als hätte sie einen erfolgreichen Rettungswurf abgelegt.

spell.name: Constant Heat
entries: Du verzauberst einen Felsen so, dass er sich mit einem Teil der Wärme, die bei seiner Erschaffung entsteht, erwärmt. Der Stein glüht rot und strahlt genug Wärme aus, um einen normal großen Raum oder eine kleine Höhle auf 70 Grad zu erwärmen. Der Stein muss mindestens 10 Pfund wiegen. Jeder, der den Felsen direkt berührt, erleidet {@damage 1d6} Feuerschaden.

spell.name: Containment Orbs
entries: Du bist von drei kleinen Kugeln aus mehrfarbiger Kraft umgeben, die bestimmte Zauber absorbieren können. Wenn du Eindämmungskugeln wirkst, wählst du für jede Kugel eine Magieschule (z.B. Abjuration, Evokation, Transmutation). Alle Zauber des entsprechenden Typs, die dich beeinflussen würden, werden von der entsprechenden Kugel absorbiert und haben keine weitere Wirkung.

Jede Kugel kann nur einen Zauberspruch absorbieren. Sobald eine Kugel einen Zauber absorbiert hat, kannst du eine Aktion verwenden, um sie explodieren zu lassen. Alle Kreaturen im Umkreis von 20 Fuß erleiden {@damage 2d6} Schaden pro Stufe des Zaubers, den die Kugel absorbiert hat, oder die Hälfte des Schadens bei einem erfolgreichen Rettungswurf in Geschicklichkeit. Der DC für den Rettungswurf wird von dir festgelegt, nicht vom ursprünglichen Zauberwirker.
Als Aktion kannst du stattdessen einen Orb wählen, um den absorbierten Zauber ohne Wirkung zu entladen.
Eine Kugel wird zerstört, nachdem sie einen Zauber entladen hat oder explodiert ist. Alle Kugeln verschwinden nach Beendigung des Zaubers ohne weitere Wirkung.

spell.name: Copy
entries: Dieser Zauber erzeugt ein perfektes Duplikat jedes geschriebenen oder gezeichneten Dokuments, das du auf leere Seiten berührst, die du zur Verfügung stellst. Du kannst bis zu 10 Seiten Text mit einem Zauberspruch kopieren. Magische Schriften, einschließlich Zauberbuchseiten, können mit diesem Zauberspruch nicht kopiert werden.

spell.name: Corpse Armor
entries: Du erschaffst eine magische Rüstung aus den Überresten eines toten Humanoiden, der so groß ist wie du oder größer. Du berührst den Leichnam, der sich daraufhin um dich herum biegt und windet, um eine grausige Rüstung aus Knochen und totem Fleisch zu formen. Behandle die Rüstung als Halbpanzer +1 (AC 16). Du musst normale Abzüge für das Tragen von Leichenrüstungen hinnehmen, wenn du nicht geübt bist im Umgang mit mittelschweren Rüstungen.

Du erhältst außerdem 25 temporäre Trefferpunkte. Der Zauber endet, wenn diese temporären Trefferpunkte aufgebraucht sind (du hast 25 Punkte Schaden erlitten). Zu diesem Zeitpunkt zerfallen die Überreste des Leichnams zu Staub.

spell.name: Corpulent Bloat
entries: Du verfluchst eine Kreatur, die du sehen kannst. Die Kreatur muss einen Rettungswurf gegen den Fluch machen. Wenn der Rettungswurf misslingt, bläht sich die Zielkreatur zu einer entsetzlichen Verhöhnung ihrer selbst auf. Nichtmagische Gürtel, Schnallen, Rüstungen, Kleidung, Schuhe und andere Kleidungsstücke werden durch schnell wachsende Fleischrollen zerstört. Das nun fettleibige Opfer vervierfacht sein Gewicht und seinen Umfang, verliert 4 Punkte Stärke und 6 Punkte Geschicklichkeit, und seine Geschwindigkeit wird um 10 Fuß reduziert. Jeden Monat verliert es einen weiteren Punkt an Konstitution. Die Fähigkeitswerte können durch diesen Zauber nicht unter 1 gesenkt werden.
Wenn der Fluch durch Magie aufgehoben wird, nimmt die Kreatur sofort wieder ihre ursprüngliche Größe an.

spell.name: Corrupt Water
entries: Du verwandelst einen Bereich des Wassers, den du sehen kannst, in eine giftige, toxische Substanz. Der Zauber wirkt auf maximal 10.000 Kubikfuß Wasser (stelle dir zehn Würfel zu je 10 Fuß auf einer Seite vor). Jede Kreatur, die ihren Zug in dem Wasser beginnt oder das Wasser betritt, erleidet {@damage 5d6} Giftschaden und wird {@condition poisoned}, solange sie sich in dem verdorbenen Wasser aufhält; ein erfolgreicher Rettungswurf auf die Konstitution negiert den Effekt bei dieser Kreatur. Wenn das betroffene Gebiet Teil eines größeren Gewässers ist, wird neues Wasser, das in das Gebiet eindringt, giftig, während Wasser, das das Gebiet verlässt, nicht mehr betroffen ist.

spell.name: Crag Warrior

m.text: a handful of crushed gemstones worth 1,000 gp

entries: Du verwandelst Felsen und Steine in der Nähe in eine belebte Steinfigur, die für dich kämpft. Die Objekte müssen vorher nicht in humanoider Form sein; sie werden durch den Zauber magisch geformt, als hätte ein Meisterbildhauer sie zu einer großen Statue geschnitzt.

Der entstehende Felsenkrieger hat die gleichen Werte wie ein Steingolem, nur dass er nicht die Fähigkeit "Langsam" dieser Kreatur hat. Der Felsenkrieger agiert nur, wenn du eine Aktion ausgibst, um ihn zu befehligen. In diesem Fall bewegt er sich und führt in deinem Zug Aktionen nach deinen Wünschen aus.
Wenn der Felsenkrieger auf 0 Trefferpunkte reduziert ist, endet der Zauber und die Felsen kehren in ihre natürliche Form zurück.

spell.name: Crawling Chaos

m.text: an iridescent gem worth 500 gp

entries: Du erschaffst ein Feld aus bösartiger, chaotischer Energie in deiner Nähe und wählst eine Kreatur, die du sehen kannst, als Ziel. Das Feld ist ein 5-Fuß-Würfel, der neben dir erscheint. Am Ende eines jeden deiner Züge bewegt sich der Würfel auf dem kürzesten Weg 30 Fuß auf sein Ziel zu. Das Feld kann fliegen und durch Kreaturen und feste Gegenstände hindurchgehen. Kreaturen, die sich zu irgendeinem Zeitpunkt im selben Raum wie der Würfel aufhalten, müssen einen Rettungswurf in Charisma ablegen. Bei einem Fehlschlag würfelst du {@dice 1d10} auf der folgenden Tabelle, um die Auswirkungen auf ihr Verhalten zu entdecken.
You can change the field's target to another creature you can see as a bonus action; the field then pursues that target.

rows: Creature is {@condition incapacitated} until the start of your next turn. If it moves, it must move as far as it can in a random direction.
The creature is {@condition stunned} until the start of your next turn.
The creature immediately makes a melee attack against the nearest creature within its reach.

spell.name: Create Crypt Thing

m.text: a clay pot filled with grave dirt and a black pearl worth at least 100 gp

entries: You animate one medium or large corpse you can see into a {@creature crypt thing|fef 3pp} (see Fifth Edition Foes from Frog God Games). The newly-created crypt thing guards the area where it was created.

spell.name: Create Iceberg

m.text: a translucent gemstone worth at least 100 gp

entries: You freeze seawater to create a chunk of ice with a volume of up to 8,000 cubic feet. Sufficient seawater must be present to support the iceberg, or the spell fails. A simple way to envision 8,000 cubic feet is a cube with 20-foot sides, or a cone 20 feet high and 40 feet in diameter at the base.
Unless the iceberg is in arctic conditions, it melts at a rate determined by the GM, but usually 5 cubic feet per hour in temperate conditions.

spell.name: Creation's Fury
entries: You unleash cataclysmic forces of nature over a vast area. The area affected is an entire geographic region within sight of the caster, such as a valley, the caverns beneath a mountain, or a lake from shore to shore. If the geographical area is especially large (a great plain, an ocean, etc.), then even this spell can't affect it entirely. Assume a maximum 1-mile-radius area of effect centered on a point chosen by the caster. To properly channel the massive energy this spell requires, the caster must be within the area of effect, if only at its periphery.

The entire chosen region becomes a nightmare of natural disasters. Scalding geysers erupt. Caverns collapse. Crevasses split wide open. All structures and living creatures in the area of effect sustain {@dice 5d6} points of bludgeoning damage, or half damage with a successful Dexterity saving throw. You are knocked {@condition prone} and {@condition stunned} for {@dice 2d6} rounds immediately after casting creation's fury, and you can't cast any spells except cantrips for 30 days afterward.
The exact effect of the destruction wrought by this spell must be determined by the GM.

spell.name: Creeping Eye
entries: One of your eyes extrudes from its socket until it pops loose, when it is replaced by another eye that grew behind the original. The eye that popped out of your head becomes a mobile, eyelike object that can animate its ganglia of trailing nerves to crawl 5 feet per minute, as long as you concentrate on its movement. You can see whatever the eye can see.

An identify spell cast on the eye reveals your name. The eye has AC 10 and 1 hit point. It disappears when reduced to 0 hit points, and its destruction stuns you for {@dice 1d4} rounds and blinds you for {@dice 1d6} minutes.

spell.name: Crew with the Dead
entries: You animate all dead humanoid creatures you can see within 60 feet of yourself to act as a crew for a ship or boat. Treat the animated corpses as zombies or skeletons, as appropriate. They have a +8 bonus on skill checks related to crewing the ship, but they are incapable of doing anything else. They must be constantly commanded (by your mental commands) or they do nothing. If your concentration is broken, they halt their activity immediately and you must spend an action to regain control over them.
The undead crew does not fight, even if commanded to do so. If instructed to do anything but operate a boat, they simply stand in place, doing nothing.

spell.name: Crystal Wail
entries: You give a piercing scream that vibrates in a 40-foot radius sphere centered on you. Unattended crystal or glass items in the affected area take {@damage 7d6} thunder damage. Each creature in the area takes {@damage 7d6} thunder damage and is {@condition deafened}, or takes half damage and is not {@condition deafened} with a successful Constitution saving throw.
A {@condition deafened} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns; a successful save restores its hearing.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: For each spell slot used higher than 4th level, the spell does {@scaledamage 7d6|4-9|1d6} extra damage.

spell.name: Curse of Horror
entries: You choose a creature you can see and name an object. The creature instantly develops a powerful phobia of that object unless it makes a successful Wisdom saving throw against curses. If the creature can see the object it fears at the start of its turn, it must make a successful Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} until the start of its next turn.
The curse can be ended only by magic that lifts a curse.

spell.name: Curse of Infirmity
entries: You curse a creature you can see. The creature loses 4 points of Strength and Dexterity (to a minimum of 1) and must make a Constitution saving throw. If the saving throw fails, the curse is permanent until it's lifted by magic. A successful save means the curse lasts only one minute, unless it's ended magically before then.

spell.name: Curse of Light
entries: You curse one creature you can see. That creature becomes highly sensitive to light unless it makes a successful Constitution saving throw. The cursed creature has tactical disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight when it, you, or whatever it is trying to perceive or attack is in bright light.

spell.name: Curse of the Ancient Mariner
entries: This ancient and powerful rite causes disastrous luck to befall the captain of a sea vessel. The captain can never again safely sail the seas or be part of the crew on a seagoing ship.

The target of this curse has the material component hung around his neck, marking him as cursed. Placing the component around the target's neck requires a successful melee attack. Even if it is removed immediately, the curse takes effect. From this point on, the target can never safely set foot on a ship again.

The effects of the curse can be manifold; a colossal sea monster might attack the ship the cursed creature is on, or terrible weather could becalm it, smash it, or the ship could spring leaks, or its food and water supplies could rot, etc. The GM is encouraged to be creative about plaguing the ship; many unfortunate things can happen before the ship is destroyed or sunk to make the crew's lives miserable and make them hate the cursed mariner. Eventually, however, the curse always destroys a ship that the target sails on.
This curse can be removed only with a wish spell or comparable magic.

spell.name: Curtain of Fire

m.text: a fire opal worth 1,000 gp

entries: You bring into existence a curtain of flickering purple and pink flames that burns the life out of everything it touches. The curtain is 1 inch thick, up to 20 feet high, and up to 400 feet long. It is roughly straight; it can't be curved or folded. You must be able to see the entire curtain when the spell is cast.

The curtain moves in a direction of your choice at a rate of 5 feet per round, consuming all organic matter in its path. Once a direction is chosen, the curtain moves that direction for the spell's duration. If the spell is maintained for its full duration, the curtain of fire will advance 500 feet and leave a scorched area 500 feet long by 400 feet wide.

The flames generate no heat, but all organic material coming into contact with the curtain is treated as if struck by a disintegrate spell. Buildings and items made from stone or metal are unharmed, but the magical fire can pass through up to 2 feet of stone or 2 inches of any metal and continue advancing. The magical fire burns life out of the soil as well, extending its horrid power to a depth of 5 feet beneath the surface of the earth.
Areas struck by a curtain of fire are easy to identify, as they are nothing but burned-out scars of black dust and sand unable to support any life.

spell.name: Damage Morale
entries: You select one creature you can see. The creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. If it fails, the creature has tactical disadvantage on morale checks and on saving throws against fear, and a −2 penalty on attack rolls, for the duration of the spell.

spell.name: Dance of Seduction
entries: By dancing and moving seductively, you attempt to charm humanoids within range. Each creature that can see you must make a Wisdom saving throw, with tactical advantage if you or your companions are fighting it. If the saving throw fails, it is {@condition charmed} by you until the spell ends or until you or your companions do anything harmful to it. {@condition Charmed} creatures regard you as a friendly acquaintance. When the spell ends, affected creatures do not realize they were {@condition charmed} by you.

spell.name: Dancer's Grace
entries: You grant one creature 15 temporary hit points for the duration of the spell. While any those hit points remain, the creature does not take any penalties for {@condition exhaustion}, although levels of {@condition exhaustion} remain and affect the creature when the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you use a 4th-level or higher slot to cast dancer's grace, you grant an additional 5 temporary hit points for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Dancing Daggers
entries: You conjure a cloud of daggers into existence and select one creature you can see for them to attack. The targeted creature takes {@damage 6d4 + 30} piercing damage at the start of each of its turns, or half damage with a successful Dexterity saving throw. The daggers follow the creature as it moves. If the creature teleports or moves to another plane, the daggers stay where they are and don't follow. They attack only the creature they're targeted against; others can walk through them without harm.
As an action, you can redirect the daggers to attack another creature you can see within 100 feet of their current position.
The daggers disappear when the spell ends.

spell.name: Dark Curtain
entries: You create a dark curtain that must stand on a solid surface within range. You can form it into a hemispherical dome or a sphere with a radius of up to 10 feet, or you can shape a flat surface made of up to ten 10-foot-square panels. Each panel must be contiguous with another panel. In all forms, the curtain is 1 inch thick and lasts for the duration of the spell.
Each creature in the area of the curtain when it appears is pushed to one side of the curtain and takes {@damage 4d6} necrotic damage, or half damage with a successful Dexterity saving throw.

The dark curtain blocks all vision through it. Any creature trying to pass through the curtain takes {@damage 4d6} necrotic damage and must make a Constitution saving throw. If the saving throw fails, the creature fails to pass through the curtain and becomes {@condition frightened} of it until the end of its next turn.

spell.name: Dark Empowerment

components.m: a small idol of a fiendish creature

entries: You summon a fiend to inhabit your body and grant you its strength. For the duration of the spell, your Strength score becomes 21, you gain 40 temporary hit points, and you gain a +2 bonus to AC. You also grow wicked claws on your hands, so your unarmed attacks do {@damage 2d8} slashing damage; the claws are magical, so you get a +1 bonus to hit and to damage with them.

At the start of each of your turns, you must make a DC 10 Charisma saving throw. If the saving throw fails, the fiend takes control of your actions for the remaining duration of the spell. It has full access to your abilities. Most demons will wreak as much havoc as possible during this time, attacking your allies if possible.

spell.name: Dark Geyser
entries: You select a point on the ground that you can see. A small gate to another plane of existence opens there, expelling pure negative energy in a 5-foot radius, 30-foot high cylinder of magical darkness. At the beginning of your next turn, the cylinder grows to a 30-foot radius and 60 feet high. At the beginning of your turn after that, it vanishes from existence.

Any living creature that's in the area when the spell is cast, moves through it, or ends its turn in it, takes {@damage 8d8} necrotic damage, or half damage with a successful Constitution saving throw. Undead creatures are immune to this effect; in fact, they heal {@dice 8d8} hit points if they end their turn in the area of effect.

spell.name: Darken Forest
entries: You animate up to three trees you can see within 40 feet. The trees are treated as awakened trees (per the awaken spell). The trees won't attack you, but they are not under your control and they do attack all other living creatures in the area without distinction.

The dark and angry power animating these trees also creates an aura of panic. Every creature that starts its turn within 40 feet of one of these trees becomes {@condition frightened} unless it makes a successful Wisdom saving throw. A {@condition frightened} creature must take the Dash action and move out of the area by the safest path. If it starts its turn more than 40 feet from a darkly awakened tree, a {@condition frightened} creature can repeat the saving throw; a successful save ends the fright and leaves the creature immune to the fright effect from this batch of trees for 24 hours.

spell.name: Daze Animal
entries: Choose a Medium-size or smaller beast you can see. The beast makes a Charisma saving throw. If it fails, it can't take actions or reactions until the start of your next turn.

spell.name: Dead Man's Hands
entries: You transform your hands into filthy, dirt-caked claws so that while the spell lasts, you are proficient with unarmed strikes and your unarmed strikes do {@damage 1d6} slashing damage. If you do 5 or more damage with an unarmed strike, your opponent must make a Constitution saving throw. If it fails, the target creature is {@condition poisoned} until the end of your next turn.

spell.name: Death Bringer

components.m: a bone dagger made from an animated skeleton

entries: Using an ancient evil spell, you stab yourself in the chest and magically spread the pain over a wide area, potentially bringing death to sleeping creatures as far as a mile away. You take {@damage 5d8} piercing damage (which can't be reduced) and are {@condition stunned} for 5 rounds. Sleeping creatures with fewer than 25 hit points within 1 mile of you die instantly unless they make successful Constitution saving throws. Survivors, as well as creatures with more than 25 hit points, awaken suddenly from a nightmare that included the figure of Death looming over them and trying to slay them.

spell.name: Death Gaze
entries: Your pupils reshape to resemble skulls. When a creature starts its turn within 30 feet of you, you can force it to make a Constitution saving throw if it can see your eyes and you can see it. If the saving throw fails, the creature takes {@damage 6d8} necrotic damage and is {@condition incapacitated} until the start of its next turn.

A creature that isn't surprised can avoid the saving throw by averting its gaze at the start of its turn. It takes the normal penalty for attacking an unseen target if it attacks you before the start of its next turn.
If you meet your own gaze through a reflection, you must also make the saving throw.

spell.name: Death March
entries: You create the image of an undead drummer in a tattered military uniform in an unoccupied space you can see. The drummer is completely incorporeal and unable to interact with anything around it. As a bonus action on your turn, you can cause it to move 25 feet in any direction. This may take it outside the initial range of the spell. The skeletal drummer taps out a death cadence on its drum as it moves.

Either at the end of the spell's duration or anytime at your command, the drummer explodes in a fiery burst. Every creature within 10 feet of the drummer takes {@damage 4d6} fire damage, or half damage with a successful Dexterity saving throw.

spell.name: Death Rattle
entries: You exhale a foul-smelling gust toward a creature you can see. The creature must make a Constitution saving throw. If the saving throw fails, the target gains one level of {@condition exhaustion} that lasts for the duration of the spell. The affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns; a successful save ends the spell.

spell.name: Death Spores
entries: You exhale a 30-foot cone of infectious spores. Each creature in the cone must make a Constitution saving throw against disease. If the saving throw fails, the creature takes {@damage 6d6} poison damage and becomes {@condition poisoned} and infected, or it takes half damage and suffers no other effect with a successful save.

Purple-black fungus oozes from the eyes and nose of infected creatures. Any creature touching the infected creature must make a Constitution saving throw or be affected the same as by the initial effect; a successful save means the creature is unaffected.

Only magic that cures diseases can end the effect. If the caster must touch the patient to cast the spell, then the caster is also exposed to the fungus and must make a Constitution saving throw against it.

spell.name: Death's Imposition
entries: The magic you weave around one living creature makes it believe it has died. It falls {@condition unconscious} unless it makes a successful Charisma saving throw.

At the end of each of its turns, the creature can repeat the saving throw. If the saving throw succeeds, it wakes up and the spell ends. Otherwise, it takes {@damage 4d8} necrotic damage, remains {@condition unconscious}, and the spell continues. If an adjacent creature spends an action trying to awaken the affected creature, it gets tactical advantage on its next saving throw.

If the creature remains {@condition unconscious} but alive for ten rounds (1 minute, the spell's full duration), it must make a Constitution saving throw at the end of its turn instead of a Charisma saving throw. If the Constitution saving throw fails, the creature dies.
The creature instantly awakes when the spell ends. Creatures immune to charming are not affected by death's imposition.

spell.name: Deathly Gaze

m.text: two jade eyeballs worth 100 gp

entries: You gain a gaze attack that only affects undead. Every undead creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of you must either avert its gaze or make a Constitution saving throw; if the saving throw fails, the creature takes {@damage 5d8} radiant damage. To be affected, the undead creature must be able to see your eyes, and you must be able to see it. A creature that averts its gaze suffers the usual penalties for attacking an unseen target, if it attacks you. Once a creature averts its gaze, it remains averted until the start of its next turn. A creature can't avert its gaze while it's surprised.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: For each spell slot used higher than 5th level, the damage from deathly gaze increases by {@scaledamage 5d8|5-9|1d8}.

spell.name: Debilitate
entries: Choose one creature within range you can see. If the creature fails a Constitution saving throw, it feels a shooting pain in its limbs. For the duration of the spell, when it uses a thrown or ranged weapon except for a crossbow or similar mechanical weapon, the range of that weapon is reduced by half and it has tactical disadvantage on its attack. The target creature also suffers a 10-foot reduction in its speed. At the end of its turn, the creature can make another Constitution saving throw; the spell ends if the save succeeds.

spell.name: Decorate Object
entries: You add details to one crafted object you touch, or alter its existing details. The changes are purely cosmetic and do not alter its properties in any way.

spell.name: Decrypt
entries: You gain insight into an encrypted message you are holding when you cast this spell. This spell gives you tactical advantage on ability checks you make to decipher the document. It doesn't grant understanding of languages you don't know; comprehend languages or similar magic might also be necessary to make the message legible.

spell.name: Deep Freeze
entries: You touch a creature and attempt to freeze its body. The creature must make a Constitution saving throw. If the saving throw fails, the creature is {@condition restrained} for the duration as its body becomes covered in ice, and it takes {@damage 3d8} cold damage at the start of each of its turns. On a successful save, it takes {@damage 5d8} cold damage immediately but suffers no other effect.

A creature {@condition restrained} by the spell repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If the saving throw fails, the creature completely freezes and becomes ice; treat it as {@condition petrified}. If the creature makes three successful saving throws (which don't need to be consecutive), the spell ends and it is no longer {@condition restrained}. Note that the creature continues making Constitution saving throws even while {@condition petrified}, unless the condition becomes permanent (see below).

If the caster maintains concentration for the full minute, a creature turned to ice is permanently frozen in that form; it stops making Constitution saving throws to end the effect. It remains frozen, however, only if the ambient temperature is below freezing. The creature can be returned to normal by being gradually thawed.

spell.name: Deflect Ram
entries: You protect the ship you are on from ramming attacks. Your ship gains resistance to bludgeoning damage for the duration of the spell.

spell.name: Delay Death

components.m: a piece of stone from a tombstone

entries: You give one willing creature you can see the ability to keep fighting despite near-lethal wounds. When the creature drops to 0 hit points without being instantly killed, it does not become {@condition unconscious} but can keep acting normally. The creature still makes death saving throws and dies if it fails three times or if it takes enough damage to cause instant death. The creature does not automatically fail death saving throws when it takes damage. Delay death has no effect on a creature already at 0 hit points when the spell is cast.

spell.name: Delude
entries: You change your alignment aura to be that of one creature you can see within range. Spells that detect your alignment thus give a false reading. The alignment aura of the creature you have copied doesn't change.

spell.name: Demon Flesh

components.m: a bit of flesh from a demon

entries: You touch a willing creature and give its skin the defensive properties of demon flesh. The creature gains resistance to cold and fire damage and to damage from nonsilvered, nonmagical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing weapons.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast demon flesh using an 8th-level or higher spell slot, the creature gains immunity to cold and fire damage instead of resistance.

spell.name: Deny Succor
entries: You curse a creature you can see within range. That creature must make a Wisdom saving throw with tactical disadvantage. If it fails the saving throw, it is unable to regain hit points by any means until the curse is lifted by magic. Remove curse and similar magic is effective against this curse only if cast using a spell slot of 6th level or higher.

spell.name: Desail
entries: The mainsail of one ship you can see becomes insubstantial for the duration of this spell. The loss of a mainsail reduces the ship's speed by a percentage equal to the sail's percentage of the ship's total sails. On many smaller ships, this will be 50% or more. On larger ships, it always reduces the ship's speed by at least 25%.

spell.name: Desert Refuge
entries: A willing creature you touch becomes surrounded by an aura that maintains a constant temperature of 70 degrees Fahrenheit and protects the creature from the blazing heat of day and the freezing cold of night. It also shields the creature from the effects of exposure to sun and wind but not from objects propelled by the wind, such as sand blown by a sandstorm.

spell.name: Destined Doom
entries: You curse one creature you can see within range to be vulnerable to a specific doom. You can select a specific person, a type of weapon or creature, or a location. When the person, weapon, or creature attacks the target, or the target is in the location, they suffer a −4 penalty to their AC and take an additional 5 damage from each attack.
Destined doom lasts until broken by magic that can remove a curse.

spell.name: Detect Charm
entries: You recognize automatically whether one creature you can see within range is currently {@condition charmed}.

spell.name: Detect Curse
entries: You determine whether a creature, object, or area you can see within 30 feet of you is affected by a curse. With a successful DC 20 Intelligence or Wisdom check, you can also determine the exact type of curse and its effects.
The spell doesn't function when used on an artifact.

spell.name: Detect Disease
entries: You automatically determine whether a creature, object, or area within range that you can see is diseased. If you make a successful DC 20 Wisdom (Medicine) check, you also determine the exact type of disease and its effects.

spell.name: Detect Illusion
entries: You are able to identify illusions within 60 feet of you. In the first round, you become aware of the presence or absence of illusions. In the second round, you determine the number of illusions. In the third round, you learn the location of each illusion.
For the duration of this spell, you have tactical advantage on saving throws against illusions.

spell.name: Detect Land
entries: You become aware of the location of any and all islands and continents within the spell's range. You only learn their location, not their size nor composition.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: For each spell slot used higher than 3rd level, the range increases by 10 miles per level.

spell.name: Detect Life
entries: You determine whether a creature within range that you can see is living or dead. The true status of a creature in a coma, suspended animation, or even masked with a feign death spell can be determined with this spell. Undead and animated constructs such as golems register as neither alive nor dead.

spell.name: Detune
entries: One instrument you can see becomes detuned. Anyone using the instrument in a performance has tactical disadvantage on their ability checks to play it. If the instrument is held by a creature, that creature makes a Wisdom saving throw when the cantrip is cast; a successful save negates the effect.

spell.name: Devour Essence
entries: You consume the essence of a creature that died within the past day. By doing so, you gain some of the general knowledge of that creature. This gives you a +5 bonus and tactical advantage on Charisma (Deception) checks when pretending to be that person. Until you are slain, the creature can't be brought back to life by any means, as you have prevented the creature's soul or spirit from going to its reward.

spell.name: Devouring Darkness
entries: A cloud of darkness erupts from a point that you can see. The cloud fills a 20-foot-radius sphere around the target point. Everything inside the affected area is heavily obscured. Each creature in the cloud when it appears takes {@damage 8d6} necrotic damage, or half damage with a successful Constitution saving throw.
Creatures slain by devouring darkness rise {@dice 1d4} rounds later as shadows.

spell.name: Dig
entries: For the duration of this spell, you can excavate 1,000 cubic feet (a cube 10 feet square) of earth, sand, or mud each round. You can expand an existing hole or start a new one. You can't dig through solid stone or mortared stone walls.

The earth removed from the hole is scattered evenly around the hole. If you dig deeper than 20 feet, the hole has a 15% chance of collapsing (roll of 1–3 on {@dice 1d20}). The chance the hole collapses increases by 5% for every 5 feet you dig beyond 20 feet unless it is braced or supported.

You can also use this spell to tunnel through earth. If the tunnel is longer than 10 feet, it has a 30% chance of collapsing (1–6 on {@dice 1d20}), +5% for every 5 feet beyond 30 feet, unless the tunnel is braced or supported.
Most creatures can easily react quickly enough to step aside automatically if you try digging beneath them.

spell.name: Dire Rage
entries: Your animal companion takes on an unnaturally ferocious appearance and its muscles throb with adrenaline. Until the spell ends, its melee attacks do an additional {@damage 2d6} damage and it has tactical advantage on attack rolls, but all creatures attacking it also have tactical advantage on their attacks. When the spell ends, the creature gains one level of {@condition exhaustion}.

spell.name: Disable
entries: A creature you touch must make a Constitution saving throw. If the saving throw fails, it is cursed and all of its ability scores are reduced to 3. The curse and the ability reduction can be ended by remove curse or comparable magic.

spell.name: Disassemble
entries: One constructed object you touch falls to pieces, separating into its component parts. For instance, a sword separates into a blade, handle, guard, and pommel, while a chariot collapses into nails, wood, and metal. If the item is in the possession of a creature, the creature can make a Wisdom saving throw. On a successful save, the item is unaffected.

spell.name: Discern Lycanthrope
entries: Choose a creature you can see within range. If that creature fails a Wisdom saving throw, you determine whether or not the creature is a lycanthrope. You can determine what kind of lycanthrope the creature is with a successful DC 20 Intelligence (Nature) check.

spell.name: Discordant Chorus
entries: You create powerful strains of music that emanate from a point you can see to fill a 60-foot sphere. The music is so loud inside that area that only shouting can be heard over it. No spells with a verbal component can be cast in the area. All creatures have tactical disadvantage on Wisdom saving throws and Wisdom ability checks while in the affected area.

spell.name: Dissonance
entries: One creature you can see takes a −2 penalty on the next ability check it makes as part of a performance unless it makes a successful Wisdom saving throw.

spell.name: Distance Distortion
entries: Select an area of up to 8,000 cubic feet. (An easy way to picture this is eight 10-foot cubes.) The selected area must be contiguous and can't be less than 10 feet across at any point. The entire area must be within the spell's range. Inside that area, distance is distorted to be twice or half what it actually is (your choice). The change must be the same in the entire area.

For example, if distance is doubled in a 30-foot section of corridor, creatures moving, attacking, or looking along it would treat it as if it were 60 feet long. A 20-foot-deep pit could become effectively 40 feet deep. Conversely, if distance is halved, a 60-foot corridor would be treated as only 30 feet long. Weapon and spell ranges are affected by the change, as is falling damage. There is no apparent change in the size of creatures or objects in the affected space, but the space itself appears longer or shorter. That is, a 60-foot corridor that's distorted to be 120 feet long does look 120 feet long from both ends, and someone in the middle of it sees the end as being 60 feet away.

spell.name: Divine Assimilation
entries: You take on some of the attributes of your deity. The exact attributes depend on your deity's alignment:

entries.name: Lawful Good
entries: You gain +2 AC, 30 temporary hit points, and resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage. Chaotic Evil creatures must make a successful Wisdom saving throw when they first see you or become {@condition frightened} for the duration of the spell.

entries.name: Neutral Good
entries: As a bonus action, three times during the duration of this spell, you can provide {@dice 5d6} points of healing to all allies within 30 feet of you. Creatures attempting to attack you or include you in the area of an offensive spell must make a Charisma saving throw; if the saving throw fails, they can take no action that turn. Neutral Evil creatures must make a successful Wisdom saving throw when they first see you or become {@condition frightened} for the duration of the spell.

entries.name: Chaotic Good
entries: You get tactical advantage on ranged attacks, and ranged attacks against you have tactical disadvantage. Lawful Evil creatures must make a successful Wisdom saving throw when they first see you or become {@condition frightened} for the duration of the spell.

entries.name: Lawful Neutral
entries: You gain +4 AC and are immune to charm, fright, and {@condition exhaustion}. Chaotic Neutral creatures must make a successful Wisdom saving throw when they first see you or become {@condition frightened} for the duration of the spell.

entries.name: Chaotic Neutral
entries: You add {@dice 1d4} to your saving throws, ability checks, skill checks, and attack rolls, as you become infused with unpredictable luck. You can detect Law at will, and Lawful Neutral creatures must make a successful Wisdom saving throw when they first see you or become {@condition frightened} for the duration of the spell.

entries.name: Lawful Evil
entries: You gain a {@dice 2d6} bonus on melee damage rolls, and your weapon is considered magical. Chaotic Good creatures must make a successful Wisdom saving throw when they first see you or become {@condition frightened} for the duration of the spell.

entries.name: Neutral Evil
entries: While the spell lasts, you can use an action to make a melee spell attack against a creature you can reach. If the attack hits, the creature takes {@damage 5d8} necrotic damage and must make a successful Constitution saving throw or become {@condition paralyzed}. A {@condition paralyzed} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns; a successful save ends the paralysis. Neutral Good creatures must make a successful Wisdom saving throw when they first see you or become {@condition frightened} for the duration of the spell.

entries.name: Chaotic Evil
entries: You are surrounded by hot flames as the spell fire shield. As an action, you can cause the flames to flare briefly around you; each creature within 20 feet of you takes {@damage 6d8} fire damage, or half damage with a successful Dexterity saving throw. Lawful Good creatures must make a successful Wisdom saving throw when they first see you or become {@condition frightened} for the duration of the spell.

entries.name: True Neutral
entries: You can choose the effects of one other alignment when you first cast this spell; you must always then use that choice.

spell.name: Divine Beacon
entries: When you suffer one of the following conditions, this spell causes a great beacon of light, visible only to paladins, to appear in the sky overhead. The circumstance that befell you determines the color of the beacon.

rows: Critical hunger or thirst that causes you to suffer penalties
Voluntarily triggering the beacon as an action

entries: The beacon can be seen by paladins from up to 50 miles away even in daylight, provided it's not obscured by fog or rain, or blocked by obstacles such as mountains or towering trees. If the fallen paladin is underground, the beacon appears in the subterranean chamber where the paladin fell and also in the sky above. Paladins of 10th level or higher have a 10% chance per level above 9 to see the beacon despite all obstacles.

spell.name: Divine Beacon's Answer
entries: You can cast this spell only if you can see a divine beacon (q.v.). When you cast divine beacon's answer, you are transported, along with all items you are carrying, to the location of the paladin in distress. No other living creatures can be transported by this spell.

spell.name: Divine Burden
entries: This spell places a spiritual burden on creatures that can cast divine spells. Every such creature within 30 feet of you must make a Constitution saving throw. If the saving throw fails, the creature moves at half speed, has tactical disadvantage on attack rolls, and has tactical disadvantage on Strength and Dexterity ability and skill checks. It also gains one level of {@condition exhaustion} if it uses the Dash action.

spell.name: Divine Charge
entries: Until the end of the round, your movement speed is doubled and, as long as you move only in a straight line, you can make a normal melee attack against each creature you move adjacent to. If your attack hits, the creature is knocked {@condition prone} in addition to other effects. You do not provoke opportunity attacks while moving in this fashion.

spell.name: Divine Communion

m.text: 100 gp worth of incense, which is consumed by the spell

entries: You become a channel for your god, allowing your deity to converse with others through your body. You are unaware of all that occurs or is said during this conversation. The spell doesn't compel the attention of your deity, who can choose to ignore its effects.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast divine communion using a 6th-level or higher spell slot, you can instead touch a willing creature and allow it to commune with its god.

spell.name: Divine Disconnection
entries: You sever the connection between one creature you can see and its deity. If the creature fails a Wisdom saving throw, it can't cast divine spells or channel divinity for the duration of the spell. At the end of each of its turns, the creature can repeat the saving throw with tactical disadvantage; a successful save ends the spell's effect.

spell.name: Divine Inspiration
entries: All creatures within 100 feet of you who worship your god get tactical advantage on attack rolls, ability checks, skill checks, and saving throws while the divine inspiration spell is in effect.

spell.name: Divine Intervention
entries: One creature you can see within range is protected from the magic of other gods. If the creature is unwilling, it can make a Wisdom saving throw to negate the effect. If the creature is affected, it has tactical advantage on saving throws against divine spells granted by deities other than your own. Divine spells that are beneficial (and thus require no saving throw) have a 50% chance of failing when cast on the creature, if they originate from a different deity than yours.

spell.name: Divine Mantle
entries: One creature you touch becomes warded against attack. While divine mantle is in effect, any creature that intends to aim an attack or a harmful spell at the warded creature must make a Wisdom saving throw before resolving the attack. If the saving throw fails, the attacker changes its mind at the last moment and either redirects the attack against a different target or doesn't attack at all (its choice). The warded creature can be included in area effects without first making a saving throw.

spell.name: Divine Sovereignty
entries: Your god imbues you with divine presence; all creatures of 4 Hit Dice or fewer view you as being their legitimate ruler and treat you with the reverence due a king. Alignment matters; Lawful creatures are more likely to obey your commands than are Chaotic creatures. Paladins have been known to use this spell to nullify the commands of rulers they believe are wielding power illegitimately.

spell.name: Divining Rod
entries: You call upon the natural spirits of a region to guide you to water, natural shelter, or food, assuming that such exists within a radius of 1 mile. The rod points in the direction of the object you seek but does not indicate danger along the way.

spell.name: Dolphin Fins
entries: One willing creature you touch gains webbed feet and hands, and is able to see normally while under water. The creature also gains tactical advantage on ability checks related to swimming and moving under water.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: For each spell slot used higher than 2nd level, you can affect one additional creature with this spell.

spell.name: Donor
entries: By touching two creatures simultaneously, you can transfer any number of hit points between them. Neither creature can have its hit points raised above its maximum (no temporary hit points) or lowered below 1. An unwilling creature can make a Constitution saving throw; a successful save negates the spell.

spell.name: Dragon Scales
entries: Your skin hardens and turns the shade and texture of a dragon's hide. Your base AC is 15 + your Dexterity modifier (maximum +2) for the duration of this spell.

spell.name: Dragon's Gauntlet
entries: Your hand transforms into a dragon's claw. For the duration of the spell, you can use your action to make a melee spell attack against a creature within reach; a hit does {@damage 2d6} slashing damage. When you hit, you can spend a sorcery point to do {@dice 1d6} additional acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison damage.

spell.name: Dread Scream
entries: You create sound vibrations in a 40-foot cone that produce deep feelings of dread in target creatures. Each creature in the cone must make a Wisdom saving throw. If the saving throw fails, the creature becomes {@condition frightened} of you for the duration of the spell. On a successful save, the creature isn't {@condition frightened} but does suffer a −2 penalty on saving throws against fright for the duration of the spell. Affected creatures can repeat the saving throw at the ends of their turns; a successful save ends the effect on that creature.

Although this spell is based on sound, it is vibrations that cause the fear effect. Deaf or {@condition deafened} creatures are not immune, but they do get tactical advantage on their Wisdom saving throws.

spell.name: Dream Speaker
entries: You touch one sleeping creature, which must make a Charisma saving throw. If the saving throw fails, you are able to whisper questions into its ear and have it answer in its native language. If an answer would divulge information the creature wants especially to keep secret, it can make another Charisma saving throw to avoid answering and end the spell.

spell.name: Drench
entries: You trigger a sudden, short, freezing-cold downpour just big enough to drench a single creature, or several creatures if they're standing close together. This downpour also quenches candles or a small fire.

spell.name: Dust of Death
entries: For the duration of the spell, you transform one ounce of normal sand into deadly poison (enough to affect just one creature). The poison is a fine powder that can be sprinkled on food or stirred into a drink. When mixed this way, it is difficult to detect; a successful Wisdom (Perception) check against your spell saving throw DC is needed to notice the poison before enough has been ingested to cause harm. Only the creature that is eating or drinking the poison can attempt this check, and only if they are suspicious of the food or drink. If the victim doesn't suspect the food is contaminated, no check is allowed.

A creature that consumes the poison must make a Constitution saving throw against poison at the end of each of its turns. The creature takes {@damage 6d6} poison damage if the saving throw fails, or half damage on a successful save. A creature that makes two successful saving throws is no longer affected by the poison; it still takes half damage from the second successful save, but then the poison is neutralized. The successful saves don't need to be consecutive.

spell.name: Dust to Death
entries: You instantly transmute one corpse into dust. It can't be magically animated or turned into an undead creature. The spell has no effect on undead or living creatures.

spell.name: Earth Ear
entries: By placing one ear to the ground, you determine the location and size of all creatures moving beneath or on the ground within 100 feet of you.

spell.name: Earth Shift
entries: You select a point within 300 feet that you have either traveled across or can see. You then instantly sink into the ground beneath you and a few moments later, rise up from the target point. Both the starting and ending points must be natural ground, not a constructed floor or water, but what lies between them doesn't matter.

spell.name: Earthburst
entries: You touch the ground and send a furrow of displaced earth 5 feet wide toward a point you can see. Upon reaching the target point, the earth erupts in a cylinder 30 feet in radius and 30 feet high. Creatures that were standing on top of the furrow as it passed underfoot are knocked {@condition prone} unless they make successful Dexterity saving throws. Creatures in the area of the eruption take {@damage 7d6} bludgeoning damage and are knocked {@condition prone}, or take half damage and are not knocked {@condition prone} with a successful Dexterity saving throw.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: For each spell slot used higher than 4th level, the spelldoes an additional {@scaledamage 7d6|4-9|1d6} damage.

spell.name: Earthen Blast
entries: Stone and earth erupt from your fingers in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in the area of effect takes {@damage 2d6} bludgeoning damage and can't move until the end of its next turn, or takes half damage and is not immobilized if it makes a successful Dexterity saving throw.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Für jeden verwendeten Zauberslot, der höher als Stufe 1 ist, erhöht sich der Schaden um {@scaledamage 2d6|1-9|1d6}.

spell.name: Earthen Concealment
entries: The ground reshapes itself to form a wall that is 6 inches thick, 20 feet wide, and 2 feet high. You must be able to see the entire area of affect, and it all must be within the spell's range. The wall can curve however you choose. It has AC 15 and 50 hit points. The wall provides cover the same as any earthen wall. The ground returns to its natural shape when the spell ends or when the wall is reduced to 0 hit points.

spell.name: Earthen Snare
entries: You select one creature you can see within range. The creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. If the saving throw fails, the creature disappears as it is sucked into a small, spherical, extraplanar trap just large enough to hold the creature while allowing it to turn around.

The trap is surrounded by earthen walls that are not impervious to attacks; they have AC 14, 100 hit points, and are immune to all but bludgeoning, piercing, slashing, force, and thunder damage. When the spell ends or the creature destroys the walls, the trapped creature takes {@damage 4d6} force damage and returns to the space it originally occupied or the nearest unoccupied space, where it falls {@condition prone}.

spell.name: Ebon Lightning
entries: Ebon lightning streaks from your fingers as you cast this spell. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw. If the saving throw fails, the creature takes {@damage 8d8} lightning damage and loses (expends) its highest-level spell slot for no effect. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage and doesn't lose a spell slot. Creatures with innate spellcasting lose one use of their highest-level spell instead.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: For each spell slot used higher than 7th level, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 8d8|7-9|1d8}.

spell.name: Ebon Water

components.m: bone dust from an undead creature

entries: You instill necrotic energy into up to 1,000 cubic feet (a cube 10 feet on a side) of water you can see. Each creature that enters the water or ends its turn in the water (not both in a single turn) takes {@damage 8d6} necrotic damage, or half damage with a successful Constitution saving throw.

A creature that drinks the water takes {@damage 8d6} necrotic damage and its maximum hit points are reduced by the same number, or it takes half damage and its maximum hit points aren't reduced with a successful Constitution saving throw.
At the beginning of your turn, you can use a bonus action to move the necrotic energy up to 10 feet in any direction, as long as it remains in the body of water.

spell.name: Ebonflame
entries: You select one creature you can see; the creature is engulfed in an aura of black flames. At the beginning of each of its turns, the creature must make a Constitution saving throw. If the saving throw fails, the creature takes {@damage 3d10} necrotic damage and is {@condition frightened}; on its turn, it must move as far away from the caster as it can. The spell and the fright effect end only when the spell's duration expires.

Ebonflame can't be cast on a target that's underwater. The flames follow the affected creature when it moves, but if it is magically transported out of the flames, such as by teleportation, the spell ends.

spell.name: Electrical Storm

components.m: a bit of fur and an amber rod

entries: The surrounding air within 100 feet of you erupts in a violent electrical storm. Each creature in the affected area other than you takes {@damage 12d6} lightning damage, or half damage with a successful Dexterity saving throw.

The electrical storm sets fire to combustibles and damages objects in the area. It can melt metals with a low melting point such as lead, gold, copper, silver, or bronze. The extent of this damage must be determined by the GM. If the damage caused to an interposing barrier shatters or breaks through it, the burst can continue beyond the barrier to the limit of the spell's range. Otherwise, it stops at the barrier, the same as any other spell effect.

spell.name: Electromagnetic Storm
entries: You cause an intense electromagnetic storm to break out in a cylindrical zone with a 20-foot radius and 20 feet high, at a point you can see. The spell has three effects.
First, each creature that starts its turn in the area of effect takes {@damage 1d10} lightning damage unless it makes a successful Dexterity saving throw.

Second, any attempt to use magnetism within the area of effect (to navigate, for example) is spoiled by the storm's intense magnetic field unless the opposed magnetic field is generated by a spell of level 4 or higher.

Third, any electrical current (magical or otherwise) that passes within 60 feet of the electromagnetic storm is drawn into the storm, causing everyone in the storm's area to take whatever damage the electricity would normally do. For example, assume a wizard casts lightning bolt within 60 feet of an electromagnetic storm. The bolt is drawn into the storm and it terminates there, causing its normal damage to everyone inside the electromagnetic storm.

spell.name: Elemental Cloak
entries: You infuse a willing creature with properties of creatures of either ice or fire. The creature is affected as described below, depending on which element it's infused with. These resistances and vulnerabilities completely replace any existing resistance or vulnerability to fire and cold damage that the creature had when elemental cloak was cast on it.

entries.name: Fire
entries: Resistance to fire damage, vulnerability to cold damage.

entries.name: Ice
entries: Resistance to cold damage, vulnerability to fire damage.

spell.name: Elemental Infusion
entries: You infuse one willing creature with elemental energy. The creature gains 50 temporary hit points; remaining points disappear when the spell ends. For the duration of the spell, the creature is immune to poison damage and the {@condition poisoned} condition, gains darkvision (60 feet), and has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons. The creature also gains immunity to one of the following (your choice): acid, cold, electricity, or fire damage. The affected creature's eyes faintly glow with the color of the chosen element.

spell.name: Elemental Scimitar
entries: You conjure an elemental scimitar into your hand. You choose which element it is affiliated with when you cast the spell. The scimitar acts as a +1 scimitar and has the additional abilities listed below.

entries.name: Scimitar of Air
entries: A creature struck by the scimitar must make a successful Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 30 feet in the direction of your choice and knocked {@condition prone}. The scimitar's attacks score critical hits on a natural roll of 19 or 20.

entries.name: Scimitar of Earth
entries: A creature struck by the scimitar must make a successful Constitution saving or become {@condition restrained}. It repeats the saving throw at the end of its next turn; a successful save ends the effect, but a failure results in the creature becoming {@condition petrified}. A {@condition petrified} creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns; a successful save ends the petrification.

entries.name: Scimitar of Fire
entries: A creature struck by the scimitar catches on fire. It takes {@damage 5d6} fire damage at the beginning of each of its turns until either it or an adjacent ally uses an action to extinguish the flames.

entries.name: Scimitar of Water
entries: As an action, you can slash the air with the scimitar to create a spray of acid in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in the cone takes {@damage 6d6} acid damage, or half damage with a successful Dexterity saving throw.

spell.name: Empathic Resonance
entries: One creature you touch becomes aware of the suffering it causes. Whenever the creature injures another creature, it must make a Wisdom saving throw. If the saving throw fails, then it must subtract {@dice 1d4} from every attack roll it makes for the next five rounds. Roll the {@dice d4} anew for every attack.

spell.name: Empower Companion
entries: You touch your animal companion and give it tactical advantage on all ability checks it makes for the duration of this spell.

spell.name: Encrypt
entries: You alter the writing on a scroll or piece of paper, making it unintelligible. A creature that spends a minute or more trying to decipher the text can make an Intelligence check against your spell saving throw DC; success indicates they decipher the text.

spell.name: Endless Abyss
entries: You open a 10-foot square hole in the floor within range. The hole can't appear under an occupied space. The hole is an extra-dimensional space with no bottom. Any creature falling into the pit never hits the bottom. To observers outside the hole, a creature or object that fell in appears to be just 20 feet below the level of the ground or floor, and falling endlessly without ever getting farther away. A creature who looks up after falling into the hole sees the lip of the hole receding farther and farther behind.

Flying creatures can get out of the pit without difficulty. A 20-foot rope will reach anyone who fell in, but the falling creature must make a successful Dexterity saving throw to catch the rope; if the saving throw fails, they perceive the rope as being too short to reach them.

When the spell ends, the hole closes. Every creature inside it at that moment is trapped and will plunge forever unless another endless abyss spell is cast on the same location; this reopens the pit and makes it possible to rescue trapped creatures. Other magical rescues might be possible, at the discretion of the GM.

spell.name: Enduring Missiles
entries: You create three missiles that unerringly strike creatures you can see, doing {@damage 1d6 + 1} force damage each. You can choose to have the missiles strike the same creature or split them between different creatures. After the missiles strike their targets, they return to your side and hover. As a bonus action on each of your subsequent turns, you can launch the missiles again. The missiles disappear when the spell ends.
A missile that strikes a shield spell is dispelled and doesn't return.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: For each spell slot used higher than 4th level, you gain one additional missile.

spell.name: Energetic Burst
entries: You gain 10 temporary hit points. For the duration of the spell, you can add {@dice 1d4} to your saving throws. Unused temporary hit points are lost when the spell ends.

spell.name: Enhance Oration
entries: You enhance the voice of one willing creature you touch, allowing that creature to be heard clearly by all creatures that can hear within 300 feet of it, regardless of background noise.

spell.name: Enliven Wood
entries: Up to three plants or wooden objects gain the ability to regenerate. At the beginning of each of their turns, they regain 10 hit points. An enlivened plant or object doesn't regenerate if it took fire or acid damage since its previous turn.

spell.name: Enrich Soil
entries: You restore the soil of up to one acre of land so that it can support plant life native to the area. This spell is typically used when magic or a natural disaster has spoiled the land and made it unable to support life.

spell.name: Erase
entries: You automatically remove mundane writing from up to two sheets of paper or parchment, from a single scroll, or from a surface no larger than 9 inches by 12 inches.
